definition: Kangxi radical 61 (心) as a vertical side element
to depend on/to hang on in a place/bad/to renege (on promise)/to disclaim/to rat (on debts)/rascally/to blame/to put the blame on
not to feel like (doing sth)/disinclined to
happy to partake but not prepared to do any work (idiom)/all take and no give
to stretch oneself (on waking or when tired etc)

sentences.english: I slept like a fat cat.
sentences.chinese: 你好，我是一只又胖又懒的猫。

sentences.english: who is the laziest person in your class?
I just puttered around the house.
Probably, men's uncleanliness is due to their laziness.
sentences.chinese: 男人的脏大概是由于懒。

sentences.english: You two are getting lazier and lazier.
sentences.chinese: 你们两个变得越来越懒了。

sentences.english: Find the lever of the earth since prize, you can become lazier.
sentences.chinese: 找到撬起地球的杠杆，你就能变得更懒。

sentences.english: Pandas are friendly to people, but they are very shy and kind of lazy.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫对人很友好，但他们很害羞，而且有点懒。

sentences.english: Walking around all wrinkled and creased sends a message of laziness.
sentences.chinese: 穿着皱皱巴巴的衣服，说明你很懒。

sentences.english: But stop and loiter all the time, to sing it in extatic songs.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔懒了游荡而已，哼着歌曲说说梦呓。

sentences.english: The teacher gave the lazy boy a good talking-to.
sentences.chinese: 老师把那个懒学生狠狠地批评了一顿。

sentences.english: John won't get far if he is lazy.
sentences.chinese: 约翰如果这样懒将不会有出息。

sentences.english: She's bone-idle. She's even tired of washing her own socks.
sentences.chinese: 她懒透的了，连自己的袜子都不洗。

sentences.english: But sometimes I'm afraid I will never meet you.
sentences.chinese: 或许，你不会是我的小懒。

sentences.english: He doesn't like work. In other words, he is lazy.
sentences.chinese: 他不爱工作，换句话说，他很懒。

sentences.english: Ben gets up earlier than his lazy father.
sentences.chinese: 本比他那个懒爸爸起床起的早。

sentences.english: We depend so much on computers that we become lazier and lazier.
sentences.chinese: 我们是如此依赖于计算机，以至于我们变得越来越懒。

definition: not to feel like (doing sth)/disinclined to
to have a lie-in/to dawdle in bed
to show off one's good looks shamelessly
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
happy to partake but not prepared to do any work (idiom)/all take and no give
